In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)::DataFrame
    df = copy(df) # make a copy to avoid modifying the original DataFrame
    ym = zeros(Int, nrow(df)) # create new column to store year and month
    for i in 1:nrow(df)
        ym[i] = parse(Int, string(year(df.dt[i]), lpad(month(df.dt[i]), 2, '0')))
    end
    df[:ym] = ym # add the new column to the DataFrame
    return df
end
```
This function creates a copy of the original `DataFrame` and adds a new column called `ym` by extracting the year and month from the `dt` column using `year` and `month` functions from the `Dates` module, respectively. The months are padded with zeros to ensure that they have two digits. Finally, the resulting integer is stored in the newly created column `ym`.
